roles: law student
law degree graduate
supporting_quotes: Moussa finished his education after earning a degree in law from Cairo University in 1957.

roles: diplomatic missions officer
supporting_quotes: Moussa then began his diplomatic career between 1958 and 1972 he worked in several missions, including Egypt's Embassy in Switzerland and the Egyptian mission to the United Nations.

organizations: Egyptian mission to the United Nations

supporting_quotes: Moussa then began his diplomatic career between 1958 and 1972 he worked in several missions, including Egypt's Embassy in Switzerland and the Egyptian mission to the United Nations.

roles: advisor to the Minister of Foreign Affairs
supporting_quotes: From 1974 to 1977, he was an advisor to the Minister of Foreign Affairs.

roles: Director of the Department of International Organizations
supporting_quotes: From 1977 to 1981 and again from 1983 to 1990, he was the Director of the Department of International Organizations at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

roles: Deputy Permanent Representative of Egypt
supporting_quotes: From 1981 to 1983, Moussa was the Deputy Permanent Representative to the United Nations in New York

roles: Director of the Department of International Organizations
supporting_quotes: From 1977 to 1981 and again from 1983 to 1990, he was the Director of the Department of International Organizations at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

roles: Ambassador to India
supporting_quotes: then from 1983 to 1986 Ambassador to India.

roles: Permanent Representative of Egypt
Egyptian Ambassador to the United Nations
supporting_quotes: In 1990, he was promoted Permanent Representative of Egypt to the United Nations.
Egyptian Ambassador to the United Nations: In office 1 January 1990 – 20 May 1991

roles: Minister of Foreign Affairs
supporting_quotes: He was named Minister of Foreign Affairs by Prime Minister Atef Sedki on 20 May 1991. He was minister until 15 May 2001
Minister of Foreign Affairs: In office 20 May 1991 – 15 May 2001

roles: Secretary-General
supporting_quotes: On 15 May 2001, Moussa was selected as Secretary-General of the League of Arab States and took office on 1 June 2001.
6th Secretary-General of the Arab League: In office 1 June 2001 – 1 July 2011

roles: member of the High Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change for International Peace and Security
supporting_quotes: On 2003, he became a member of the United Nations High Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change for International Peace and Security.

roles: president of the committee of 50 to amend the Egyptian constitution
supporting_quotes: On 8 September 2013, he was elected president of the committee of 50 that will amend the Egyptian constitution.

roles: founder
supporting_quotes: After the election, he formed the Conference Party with which a number of smaller opposition parties aligned.

roles: presidential candidate
supporting_quotes: Amr Moussa announced that he would be running as a presidential candidate on 1 March 2011.
Moussa placed fifth in the election with 11.13% of the first round vote.
